    • Constructor Detail

      • Map

        public Map(java.lang.String glassWindowName,
           int difficulty,
           int row,
           int column)
    throws notValidMatrixException
        class constructor initialize the object Map type
        Parameters:
        glassWindowName - name of the matrix, refers to the corrispondent card
        difficulty - level of difficulty of the matrix
        row - number of row of the matrix
        column - number of column of the matrix
        Throws:
        notValidMatrixException - when the values of row and column are not valid to construct the matrix

      • alreadyExistInColumn

        public boolean alreadyExistInColumn(int column,
                                    Color color,
                                    int value)
                             throws notValidCellException
        method that verify if a number or a color exist already in a coloumn of the matrix
        Parameters:
        column - of the matrix where you want to search the number
        color - that you are searching
        value - that you are searching
        Returns:
        a boolean that is true if the value already exist in the column of matrix, else false
        Throws:
        notValidCellException - when the indexes of the row and the column not respect the interval number of matrix.

      • alreadyExistInRow

        public boolean alreadyExistInRow(int row,
                                 Color color,
                                 int value)
                          throws notValidCellException
        method that verify if a number or a color exist already in a row of the matrix
        Parameters:
        row - of the matrix where you want to search the number
        color - that you are searching
        value - that you are searching
        Returns:
        a boolean that is true if the value already exist in the row of matrix, else false
        Throws:
        notValidCellException - when the indexes of the row and the column not respect the interval number of matrix.

      • setCell

        public boolean setCell(Dice d,
                       int row,
                       int column)
                throws notValidCellException
        a method that set all the values of the cell
        Parameters:
        d - the dice you want to set in the cell of the matrix
        row - the row in which you want to set the dice
        column - the column in which you want to set the dice
        Returns:
        a boolean that is "true", if the dice is set in the cell
        Throws:
        notValidCellException - when the indexes of the row and the column not respect the interval number of matrix.

      • validPosition

        public boolean validPosition(int row,
                             int column,
                             Dice dice)
                      throws notValidCellException
        a method that verify is a position is right to put a dice inside it
        Parameters:
        row - the row you want to verify
        column - the column you want to verify
        dice - the dice you want to put in the cell, with its value and color
        Returns:
        a boolean that is "true" if it is possible to put a dice in it
        Throws:
        notValidCellException - when the indexes of the row and the column not respect the interval number of matrix.
